Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mwhite15
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little more than a mile from the airport. Even though it was so close I never heard an airplane overhead during the day or night. The hotel also provides a shuttle that begins at 4:30 am to the airport. I stayed on the 8th floor. I would recommend the higher floors if you want the view since all the rooms have balconies. The room was large and the bed was comfortable. You can see some of the age throughout the building but there is a renovation that is updating the hotel. I was a bit disappointed that they did not offer wifi in the rooms. It seems a little strange when cheaper motels offer free in room wifi but a large expensive hotel like this one does not. Hardline ethernet is available in the room and wifi is available downstairs in the common areas. I was disappointed with the breakfast as well. I have Hilton Honors and so I got my free continental breakfast. It was nothing great. I could have paid an extra $5.99 to get the hot buffet but that just wasn't appealing to myself. Once again there are plenty of hotels, including Hilton brand hotels that offer complimentry hot breakfast. Why it cannot be offered at the Hilton hotel I just don' t know. I had the military rate when I stayed at this hotel for it was a good value for myself. Along with the proximity to the airport since I had to fly out. Other than that I think I'll look around a little more to find a hotel that at least offers wifi in the rooms and a free hot breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “good location, decent facilities, pricey parking”
Reviews.Author: ErickE
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a short drive from the airport. It overlooks the north island naval base so your kids will see ships and aircraft coming and going. The $19/night parking is ridiculous... The restaurant provides a good breakfast, which is a little pricey starting at $13

Reviews.Title: “Not a high end Hilton, but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Gentle_heart
Reviews.Content: and with a great view. Great place for business travelers because it's near the airport and yet overlooks the harbor and several marinas. Rooms are clean and comfy. I slept like a rock. Breakfasts are decent. But it's a modest Hilton. Don't expect a lavish lobby or first class amenities. Still, the staff are very helpful and I would not hesitate to go back if I had another conference nearby. You will bewell taken care of here. Don't give it a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, superb views, quiet and clean”
Reviews.Author: pumpsnow1523
Reviews.Content: Location is great! very convenient to the marina and bay. Walking distance to a nice restaurant; can take a nice stroll along the shore towards downtown. Nice breeze. We stayed at the 8th floor (812) with a great view of the marina on the left, skyscrapers, mountains and bay on the right. Hotel provides a shuttle to the airport which is just 10 minutes drive from the hotel. We still used a rent-a-car to drive to different places north of San Diego; parking space is a bit steep ($19 a night). The next day we returned the car and availed of the free shuttle service to the airport. On the day of departure, the shuttle driver did not show up, and the receptionist quickly offered a taxicab alternative - paid by the hotel. Service was commendable. We used the computer station to print boarding passes complimentary from hotel. Internet requires a fee, which we didn't need and didn't use. Restaurant onsite is available, but prices of meals are high; we opted to eat at Old Town and Gaslamp quarter. Lots of restaurants at GasLamp. Indian buffet for lunch was $9.99. Hotel room: Beds were comfortable, clean, spacious, had bathrobes in the closet, non-smoking, clean smell, with balcony and chairs. Even though the hotel is close to the airport, we hardly heard any noise from the planes when the door was shut. Hot shower is a treat - no problem with water pressure. Clean towels, shampoo, conditioner, lotion and shower cap are available. They provide coffee and tea. San Diego airport has a curfew for early flights. Planes fly past 6:30am. Airport opens at 5am. We recommend staying in this hotel. Everytime we visit San Diego, we plan to stay again at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “No Handicapped rooms...”
Reviews.Author: Jsam M
Reviews.Content: Bait and switch. Even though I spoke to the hotel directly and was assured my reservation was for a wheelchair compatible room, upon check-in, only standard rooms were available. I was told the hotel has only 2 wheelchair assessable rooms, total. Even after presenting my paperwork showing the conformation of an handicapped room, the front desk was not helpful and unapologetic about the situation. The staff did offer to find me another room elsewhere, but at a significantly higher cost and 3.1 miles away. The front desk did not offer use the hotelâ€™s shuttle to go to the other hotel. Never book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor front end staff!”
Reviews.Author: willy35
Reviews.Content: Told me room wasn't ready and would call me on my cell when it was which they said would be about 40 minutes. Nearly 2 hours went by and no call. Went up to front desk and they said oh your room has been ready for quite some time, very insincere sorry! I know they weren't slammed with checkins because i could see them chit chatting with each other from my vantage point in the lounge. Very bad first impression and in hospitality that is paramount! other than that rest of the staff courteous and attentive, rooms were fine, but the video quality on the flat screen tvs was terrible and channels guides had many of the channels wrong. other associates commented regarding the video issue. we are business travelers NOT on vacation, so watching the history channel which was listed, but not there might be something important to us after a day of taxing meetings. would go 3 stars overall,but front end staff cost them a star. Would NOT reccommend to my business assocuates, sorry Hilton. Review submitted by a 10 year hilton honors member.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel on Harbor Island”
Reviews.Author: Atomique
Reviews.Content: We decided last minute to go to San Diego for a night from the Los Angeles area. I had a free night at Hilton from their rewards program and picked this hotel because of it's waterfront location. Hotel is pretty easy to find. Its close to the airport and not much traffic on Harbor Island. You are within close driving distance of the beaches and downtown. Front desk was nice, checking in didn't take long. The room was decent sized, had a big comfy bed, good decor, had a small balcony with a view of the harbor. Good sized bathroom with very nice toiletries. Every thing was clean. I've got nothing bad to say about this hotel. Its exactly what I would expect out of a Hilton. Very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “'could use some morning coffee...'”
Reviews.Author: RolloOrlando_Florida
Reviews.Content: A rather nice hotel where I've stayed over the years which has declined in amenities and service. The gym used to be much better equipped - it even sported a sauna - but now it's rather spartan, but still functional. OK but does not beat a fast walk around the Island from the walkway just across the street. Coffee in the lobby for us early risers used to be provided but now isn't, as were Sunday newspapers, also gone. Yes, these 'amenities' cost money but really, the room prices have not been reduced nor has the property been upgraded. And to reinforce another comment, avoid the hotel restaurant. It's atrociously expensive for what you get. General manager, please, put coffee and tea service back in the lobby! It's not that big of a deal.

Reviews.Title: “No value here...”
Reviews.Author: reggie5000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on a business trip in February 2012. Pros... 5 minutes from airport Clean facilities Front desk was efficient Girl in the gift shop was helpful Cons... Expect to pay for everything that you touch No free internet access in rooms (unless you are a diamond club member) No free internet access in business center (between the PC and print charge, it cost me $7.95 to print my boarding pass) No free continental breakfast or even coffee Overall the hotel is OK, nothing special but it is clean and the staff was good. $199 ($233 with taxes) for one night in a standard room plus the add ons makes this a poor value. I travel on business frequently and would rank this close to the bottom on overall value. You can stay in a much nicer hotel for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kev1438
Reviews.Content: So this hotel really doesn't have anything going for it other than that it is close to the airport and the rental car returns of Avis and Hertz. It is a standard Hilton without really any charm, including the views, which are nothing compared to the Hilton Bay Front a few miles south. Do not stay here if you are visiting San Diego for pleasure, as it is too far from anything but the airport. The rooms are fairly standard, perhaps a little bigger than the average Hilton room, though the furniture is a bit older, and the bathrooms certainly small. Air system is fairly loud and the top floor rooms are alive with the humming produced by the hotel's HVAC system part of which sits on the roof of the hotel. So at the very least avoid the top floor, which also has a low false ceiling in the hallway, making it feel dingy. They charge you here even if you park your own car a hefty $15 fee. This seems a lot when their is ample parking and no one is there to greet you at the door anyway. Customer service was fine, check-in efficent. Check-out the same. Stay here if you have an early morning flight, otherwise seek the Hilton's further to the south.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego Harbor Island”
Reviews.Author: Itravelalot2011
Reviews.Content: If you want to have a quit place to stay but still close to the city, Little Italy, and some of the best Mexican food. Stay here. Just donâ€™t order a Pizza at the hotel restaurant, unless you like breakfast sausage on your pizza, I donâ€™t and the pizza was teribble

Reviews.Title: “Great Views Peaceful Location”
Reviews.Author: CMH_Traveller43221
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at this property and very much enjoyed the stay. The front staff was fantastic. Marcos at the front desk greeted us with a warm smile. We had booked an up level harbor/city view and he indicated that we had a fantastic view from our room. Which it did of Condado and the San Diego skyline. It was worth the extra cost. The property itself appears to have recently been remodeled. Room was clean, bathroom spotless and decorating up to date. TV was flat screen and plenty of channels to choose from. I did not use the restaurant or bar so I have no reviews. The downside is it is a 40+ year old property and your do hear all the water running in the rest rooms above or below you. The best side, the staff that is very helpful and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the view!”
Reviews.Author: jmw020
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here three nights. We loved the view of downtown San Diego and the bay that we had from our balcony! We watched fireworks from our balcony on Saturday night. Our room was clean, and the bed was comfortable. It was very quiet around the hotel, which was surprising, considering the location of the airport. (Since it was on the harbor island, there was little traffic on the street out front.) We had room service for dinner later one night, and it was delivered quickly and was very tasty. We didn't miss the complementary breakfast that some hotels offer. (We tend to overeat at them anyway..) There was a parking fee, but we felt that it made the lot more secure, since only guests could park there. We were pleased with this hotel! It was relaxing and enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bagpipemarshall
Reviews.Content: We had a three day get-a-way with family between Christmas and New Years. We stayed at the Hilton Airport becasue of its proximity to downtown, the zoo, the beaches, and restaurants. The hotel was quiet, had great views, and was located on Harbor Island - a great place to walk. Parking is a little expensive, but worth the convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport, decent views, surprisingly quiet”
Reviews.Author: Windswept_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Arriving late evening after a 12hr flight, getting to a hotel quickly is a real plus. It takes a few minutes to get to/from the hotel/airport, and the shuttle seems to run on-demand. Check in was nice and quick, but this was late evening so I'd have been surprised to have seen a queue. Room was nice and large (king bed with view across the bay to downtown San Diego). Rooms have a small balcony and a couple of chairs, and sitting outside during dawn/dusk is a bonus. Given the proximity to San Diego airport and a couple of military airfields, aircraft noise wasn't that noticeable - although this may be due to it being mainly larger commercial aircraft flying around rather than the military fighters/helicopters that are more abundant slightly further up the coast. Have to admit the bathroom didn't quite live up to the room, being very small and squeezed into the corner almost as if it was after-though. The position of the shower head also made showering a bit of a limbo dance - it couldn't have been more than 5ft above the bath so if you're taller than that (like i am) you spend a lot of time stooping to get your head under the water. Wired internet in the room had decent connectivity and could maintain a VPN without any issues although the lack of in-room wireless does tie you to sitting at the desk - which was an adequate size and had a comfortable chair. As others have said, you stump up $11 a day for this connection. In the business center, printing anything other than boarding passes costs you and if my experience of using them to print a pass is anything to go buy I'd have thought them unusable if you were paying for access to the word/excel/firefox applications. They were painfully slow and froze/crashed/rebooted such that something that should have taken a couple of minutes took more like 15mins. Breakfast buffet in the hotel restaurant in okay, the cooked was in plentiful supply although the choice of fruit/cereals was more limited. Waiting staff could have been a bit more attentive and the 'seat yourself and help yourself' approach they seemed to have pretty much meant all they did was pour you a coffee and then vanish from the room for extended periods. Didn't have an evening meal there but the menu looked okay, there are a handful of other restaurants on the island, and you can walk from one end of the island to the other on walkways, so there are other options available - the Boathouse Restaurant on the next lot has a $9.99 lobster special on Wednesday, for example. If you're looking for easy access to downtown San Diego then there are probably better hotels. If you just need a base to work from and will be spending days driving outside of downtown, then its not a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: rogerandtina
Reviews.Content: We have had the pleasure of staying at this property several times and it's always fantastic! Usually, we drive in the day before we have to depart on our morning flight back east. The convenience is outstanding! The service is always very good! As a matter of fact, we are Hilton Honors members and have lodged at many Hilton properties. This hotel ranks as (one of the best for us) in cleanliness, staff professionalism &courtesy and pleasant atmosphere! We just think it's GREAT! The management should be very proud of this property and it's employees! A perfect example of how a property of this nature should be run! Thank you and hope to see you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Park N Fly!”
Reviews.Author: Boeing767
Reviews.Content: We rented a car in Southern California for an entire week, but had to come home for two days. Since we live in Hawaii, this is a new experience for us; the Hilton San Diego Airport/Harbor Island made it a breeze. The room was beautiful (although the bath was a bit small), with a spectacular view of a marina, and North Island NAS in the distance. The room was clean, and the bed comfortable. As I have said before, what made the experience, though, was the staff --- they were all friendly, and helpful. If we need to be in San Diego again, we would not hesitate for a moment to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “$11.00 a day for internet in your room”
Reviews.Author: farsideWisconsin
Reviews.Content: On the positive side the room was beautiful, comfortable bed and we were upgraded to a marina view. Extremely clean and nicely decorated. On the down side, if you want internet in the room you must pay. If you want to use the internet in the business center and don't have your laptop with you, you also have to pay. This is very inconvenient and quite the surprise at such a lovely hotel (you could print your boarding passes on the business center computer at no charge). The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The shuttle runs to the airport on demand and the drivers are very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Close to SAN Airport”
Reviews.Author: Cb1180
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights while on a quick trip to San Diego. The hotel is very convenient to the airport, but not much else. It's very isolated out on Harbor Island and as many of the other reviewers mentioned, it's not very easy to get a cab from the hotel to downtown. The shuttle runs to the airport pretty much all day - I used it a few times and found it to be very reliable and showed up at the airport within 10 min of calling. The rooms are average - nothing to write home about and overall seemed a bit dated, but clean. The staff was relatively friendly and welcoming. All in all, I'd recommend this hotel if you have a car or if you need to get to the airport early, otherwise I'd opt for a different location in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and surprisingly nice location for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: comfortablyclean
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised to find this hotel in a nice big marina and across the bay from Coronado Island. The people who work here are great. Found the room to be very clean and the resturant a bit better than the average hotel menu. My only complaint would be a 12.00 charge for a shot of mediochre vodka. We had the breakfast buffet which had varied selections enough to keep us from being bored for our 5 night stay. Samm was great at taking care of us, and other staff were helpful on a daily basis. The night manager would be the exception--griendly, but just not able to help with anything apparantly. We even had the opportunity to watch the christmas boat parade from our balcony--you are that close to the water!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at Hilton on the Bay”
Reviews.Author: Rbakken
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Harbor Island Hilton, and I came away very impressed with my overall stay. Located near Lindbergh Field and near downtown, this hotel is quick and easy to get to even if you need a quick stopover while flying through. I had a room on the 8th floor, Marina side, with a small balcony. The single king bed was comfortable and overall the room was very clean. Water pressure for the shower was good, and even though my room was near the elevator I rarely heard any hall noise. A free USA Today also greeted me in the morning. Items of note: Normally Hilton Honors members get free bottles of water, but this room had water in-room for a $5 charge. The room also had a widescreen TV, but the signal wasn't in HD and was distorted when viewing cable channels. The price to park is also outrageous - $19 a night. Try not to park if you don't have to. The extra costs knock my rating down a bit for staying here, but don't let that deter you.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly/helpful staff, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: RandyT2011
Reviews.Content: We recently attended "Carrier Classic" with another couple....since we planned a car rental, we chose Hilton for convenience to airport and view... the hotel filled the bill quite well. Though we were unable to upgrade to Harbor/city view room...we were well pleased with our 5th floor "two bed" marina side view room...each bed was much larger than a single... bathroom was small, but OK. Each encounter we had with front desk and room clean-up staff was met with cheerful demeanor and ready willingness to help with our needs. We did not utilize on site bar/meal services.....we had excellent dinners with awesome city views at nearby Island Prime and Bali Hai restaurants and picked up satisfying breakfast and lunch sandwiches/beer at the adjacent marina delicatessen.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: DesiMan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights recently. The location is ideal for Airport (3 minute shuttle ride) and harbor island activies. It is a relatively quiet neighborhood with exceptional views (speaking for 6th floor bayside room for sure). From my room #628, I was greeted by beautiful and energetic sunrise every morning. The lobby and room were very clean, hilton quality decor (not rich but nice/decent). The front desk lady who checked me in was extremely pleasant as well. Room cleaning service was excellent and prompt. I didn't eat there (Sierra Pacific restaurnt) and didn't use their gym/pool facilities due to my schedule there but they appeared clean. I used their shuttle service for airport transfers as well as for downton Gas lamp quarter visit one evening. Prompt service and no complaints. I used their free Wi-Fi service in the Lobby without issues. The only other hotel in the harbor Island is Sheraton and it can be relatively very expensive. For a quick bite, there are few delis on the island (mostly each marina has one) which offer economic alternative to expensive hotel restaurant food. Overall this is a good 3 - 3.5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Zergling_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at the Hilton to watch the America's Cup World Series. It is very conveniently located for this purpose, very close to the airport, with a free shuttle, and on the water. It is possible to take walks on Harbor Island along the shore. The hotel room was nice, typical Hilton, and because of my Gold status we had free breakfast and internet. The pool was nice and quite unoccupied at that time of year and the fitness room a nice sampling of equipment. However, we resented the $19/night parking charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great View. Reasonable Price for Last Minute Trip”
Reviews.Author: rheaigarta
Reviews.Content: If you want the harbor view, make sure you request that ahead of time or make sure you book for that room. You will be facing towards the water, you will see a lot of action on US Navy, coast guards, helicopters, view of the Coronado Island, and view of the Coronado Bridge, request for 4th floor and up. We stayed on the 6th floor Rm 625 and I was very happy with the location.Close to the elevator, vending machine, ice machine the stair way and balcony view. Marco was very helpful when we checked in on a last minute. He provided great feedback and location where to visit in the beautiful San Diego. Rooms/Amenities The beds were supposed to be Queen size, but they look more like Full size bed. Good thing my fiance and i fit on the bed. Can't complain about their pillows. :) The bathroom we stayed in is fairly small, but what do you know, it's just a bathroom. The coffee taste good, it was better than nothing, but I wish they had stirrer for me to mix the coffee. I'm not so sure if the other rooms have refrigerators, but that would have been great if we had one. Check out the Sierra Pacific during happy hour 4-6pm. Good drinks, good appetizer, great seats with big screen TV on their lounge area with the marina view. I had their tomato soup and that was really good with their crackers. They had 4 -5 drinks on tap, Stone Brewing and one other one I can't remember. Parking cost $19 a day they also do shuttle to Gaslamp District (check hotel for hours) and to the airport. Internet/WiFi isn't free, you have to pay for that as well. Good thing we didn't need it, thanks to Smartphones! Only if we knew that pets were allowed here, we could have taken our pet here with us. Overall, we had a great stay and enjoyed our view at the Hilton Harbor Island Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating!”
Reviews.Author: GatorRandy
Reviews.Content: Staff was wonderful. Very attentive and welcoming. But this property needs some serious updating! Peeling wallpaper and broken ceiling panels but the worst was the bed. It was lumpy, small and incredibly uncomfortable. The shuttle service into town is a wonderful bonus. With the caliber of staff and a great location, some physical updating could make this property a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Starting to loose it's lustre”
Reviews.Author: EduardTravels
Reviews.Content: I havenâ€™t stayed at this property for a couple years. Last time I thought it was getting a little long in the tooth. Nothing seems to have changed. The rooms are standard Hilton: comfortable, clean and nothing to make them stand-out. Bathrooms need to be updated or at least have the cabinets repainted. Internet access is still hard-wired. So whatâ€™s to like? Excellent staff, good restaurant and room service, visually pleasing location and great shuttle service. One other thing to add is that it is at the end of Harbor Island. If you need to get a cab, the wait is often longer than 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent View and Attentive Staff”
Reviews.Author: Vacation-Advocates
Reviews.Content: The proximity to the airport, downtown, and all the attractions made this stay excellent. The staff were attentive to all my needs and the view was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK Location it depends ... isolated !!”
Reviews.Author: travelbuddiee
Reviews.Content: Hotel is fine ... regular Hilton, there are a couple of delis somewhere around the street and a delicious restaurant next door, that's a plus. But If you want to get to know San Diego's best areas you have two options, one is take a cab, fare is high though, each way $15-$20. The other option which I wish I thought about sooner, is to rent a bike so you can go back and forth strolling along San Diego bay. This is a very quiet hotel, is a safe and nice waterfront hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Views”
Reviews.Author: catherineandjohn134
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in San Diego. The Hilton San Diego Airport / Harbor Island offered a competitive rate plus half the parking cost of downtown and Gaslamp hotels. We upgraded to a high level room looking towards Coronado Island and into downtown. Awesome view! Room was clean and very comfortable. We enjoyed walking on the path along Harbor island - very relaxing & beautiful views. We did not eat at the hotel. The restaurant looked nice but was more than we wanted to pay. We found a little bagel and sandwich shop across the poolside parking lot near the sailboat marina entrance where we got breakfast for half the hotel restaurant price plus we were able to buy some basics for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel but with wonderful views”
Reviews.Author: TIMB0
Reviews.Content: There are some pros and cons of this hotel, so take a good look so youâ€™re not disappointed. Stayed here for the weekend with the wife and we absolutely loved it, so obviously my review will slant to the positive. Quality â€“ Be aware that this is an older hotel and will show some signs of age. The elevators were terribly slow and were pretty noisy. The rooms were a little aged compared to some of the newer designs, but still very clean and comfortable. Due to the design of the tower, there are excellent views to be had from the balcony (every room has one with chairs). Request a room on a higher floor facing Coronado island, you wonâ€™t be disappointed! Value â€“ We booked this hotel through an online travel site and only paid $99 a night during Memorial Day weekend. We were very happy with this price compared to other (albeit newer) hotels. Unless you can get it bundled in a package, you will have to pay for gated parking. Location â€“ This was our favorite part. The hotel is situated near the airport (we NEVER heard the planes though!) on a long, narrow â€˜islandâ€™. At one end is an excellent seafood restaurant (the Lighthouse) and the other end is a Sheraton (I think). In between are just a few yacht clubs and the Hilton right in the middle. It is very secluded and not touristy at all, so it was always quiet and peaceful. In front of the hotel was a narrow road, then a jogging path and then the bay. That said, this is not walking distance from any of the usual San Diego bay area attractions. It is about a 5 min drive to Coronado (across the bridge) and 1 min drive to Seaport village. Service â€“ The service at check-in was speedy and courteous. Nothing out of the ordinary, but still a pleasant experience. Food â€“ Never tried room service or their onsite restaurant, though it looked good in the menu.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, Average Hotel, Inconvenient Location”
Reviews.Author: tgsapo
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed at this hotel for 5 days last week. The views are beautiful--right on the marina, looking out on the bay. There is a lovely walking path directly in front of it. A great place for biking or watching the fishermen. It is located very close to the airport, which is good if you are only here for a stopover but bad if you want to explore the city of San Diego. To get to any major destination is 15 minutes by car (if traffic is good)--walking is not an option. The shuttle only delivers to downtown 4 times per day. As other reviewers have mentioned, there is charge for nearly everything at this hotel. Parking, Wi-fi, internet access, and local calls all carry a charge. The restaurant and lounge are overpriced; a Cosmo was $12, breakfast $20 for one. The bottled water in the rooms carried a $5 charge. There was no refrigerator or microwave standard. The room itself was average; something I would expect to find in a Hilton hotel. Bed was good, room was quiet. Everything appeared clean. The bathroom tiles and tub were chipped slightly, but nothing excessive. Service was good. Melanie at the front desk was especially friendly and helpful. I tried using the Wi-fi, but gave up because of the shoddy coverage. I did not use the pool or fitness center, so cannot comment on those. All in all, not a bad experience. However, given the price this hotel normally charges, I would rather stay somewhere closer to activities with more value for my dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Pricey, especially with parking, internet, etc...”
Reviews.Author: Hitcher84
Reviews.Content: First stay at this hotel, which is near the airport. It is on a strip of land seemingly dedicated to upscale hotels near the airport. San Diego's airport is pretty close to downtown, so unless you really want to be next to the airport, there are lots of other options in nicer areas of San Diego. There is not much to do near the hotel. Restaurants and bars are rather far away. It is on the waterfront, and it is a nice place to jog or play catch. The rooms are spacious and appointed with your standard Hilton things. The bed is very comfortable. The extra blanket was crusty (ick...). The free internet in public areas was not working. Hilton seems to nickel and dime people with high priced extras. Wired and wireless internet service costs over $10 for 24 hours, parking was $19, the hotel lounge and restaurant are overpriced. I used points, so I cannot comment on the overall price beyond that. Also, room service is not 24 hours, and the bar closes rather early (11P). I sort of like Hilton hotels because they have comfortable beds and usually good service, but I would not stay here again unless there was a really good price. I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “not this hilton ever again”
Reviews.Author: dihome
Reviews.Content: this was the dirtiest hilton i have ever stayed at and we are hilton honors members.the floor carpet was terrible bathroom trash can had something all over it and they never cleaned the bathtub for the 3 days we were there when they replaced the towels they never gave back the same amount and had to call for more each day. It was bad i should of calledfor a manager but we just wanted to go and have fun i also should of called hilton honors and told them but it would of just landed on deaf ears with them saying the manager will call you Right. Nerver stay at this hilton it should be remodeled or something

Reviews.Title: “At the top of my list”
Reviews.Author: CallMeJackie
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here in a room (two comfortable double beds) on the 9th floor with views of the bay and downtown. The room was clean, well appointed and nicely decorated. The bathroom was spacious with a nice shower and good water pressure. The views were spectacular, and we spent hours on the balcony enjoying the skyline as well as all the activity on the bay and at the North Island Naval Air Station. The location was great, close enough to the attractions we wanted to see (downtown, Balboa Park, Point Loma), but away from a lot of the hubbub with very little car traffic on Harbor Island Drive. The marina next door conveniently offered sundries, snacks, and liquor (as well as a full-service restaurant). The highlight of this property, however, was the staff. I cannot say enough good things about the genuine friendliness we encountered everywhere, from the front desk to housekeeping to the restaurant. I have been a Hilton Diamond member for many years, and this hotel is definitely near the top of my list of all-time favorites. Thank you for making us feel so comfortable during this very enjoyable reward stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: BrookeRines
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this for vacationers, as it is kind of out of the way. However, I am very pleased. The rooms are clean, the bed is SUPER comfy and I have a cute little balcony that overlooks the pool and the marina. It is an airport hotel, so expect to hear the planes. It is not very quiet, but the noise translated to white noise after a brief time. The only negative thing I can say is that the water pressure leaves a great deal to be desired and the tub didn't drain as quickly as I would have liked. However, lots and lots of hot water. I was attending a convention at another area hotel, and utlilized a shuttle that was very convenient, always on time, and the drivers were very polite. All in all, it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel, but a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Evanston_Jeff
Reviews.Content: I struggled with whether to give this hotel as a 3- or 4-star ranking. In the end, the lack of reliable transportation into the city and being out of the way swayed my personal opinion maybe a bit too harshly. I had a view of Coronado Island and i enjoyed watching the activities at the Naval Airstation, although the helicopters were loud, and I could understand why this might annoy some people, but I was mesmerized by all the activity. If this does not appeal to you, this might not be the right hotel for you (air activities sometimes lasted until 10 or 11PM). The other side of the hotel may not be much better as it is on the flight path to the commercial airport. The bed in the room was a bit soft, and the shower head was mounted low, which for me being so tall, was inconvenient. There was a jacuzzi-tub in my room, which I did not use. The room was well-maintained although the common areas were clean, but a bit spartan. Getting a taxi into the city was difficult as the hotel is near the end of a dead-end street which meant that taxis did not frequent the street, and had to be dispatched to the hotel, which would take between 10-30 minutes. The restaurant was fine for breakfast, although it was a bit underwhelming. I had room-service one night which was similarly OK, and there is a restaurant at the end of the street (~10 minute walk) which was a very good seafood restaurant. Otherwise the dining options were limited. An airport shuttle from the hotel was available. Overall this was an OK hotel. If you had your own car, it would be fine but people sensitive to outside noise might be annoyed by the nearby airports, although I actually loved this aspect of the hotel's location.

Reviews.Title: “Could be nice if it weren't one of the noisiest hotels I've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: LGGreene
Reviews.Content: Super inexpensive for the location. Updated, big rooms. Comfy beds. But the walls are PAPER thin. We heard absolutely every toilet use in the hotel and were woken at 4 am by commercial trucks backing up in front of the hotel and sounding that "beep, beep, beep" noise they do. We were also treated to a violent screamfest on the part of the person in the room next to us. We heard every single curse word and insult he lobbied at the person in the room with him. Lastly, the room service food was terrible. Cafeteria quality, at best.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Delivers Again”
Reviews.Author: lorider11
Reviews.Content: This Hilton hotel is a great business hotel in the heart of San Diego. What I appreciate about this hotel is that you're not in the thick of the Gas Lamp Quarter, it has east free way access in any direction, the rooms are quiet with nice views and if you get a room facing west, you can see our Naval Aviators practicing take-off and landings for patrols. The restaurant serves excellent food and the staff are very professional.

Reviews.Title: “great location with wonderful bay view”
Reviews.Author: mistyskyblue
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at a great location - Harbor Island. We had a room with a wonderful bay view. It is very pleasant to wake up and see the bay, all the sail boats, and people walking on the board walk. The room is not big , but is clean and service is nice. The front desk is courteous and helpful. I had an issue with wireless connection and the manager was kind enough to let me use the connection in the room without charging me. The hotel was remodeled 4 years ago. The bathroom has a tub and shower which is nice, except it is hard to control the water temperature. It it either too hot or too cold. The bed is a little too soft. Other than this, it has been a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “One big clip joint”
Reviews.Author: Ashokan1
Reviews.Content: Rooms are glorified broom closets Additional fees for Parking, Internet, Printer usage. Breakfast, everything else No fridge or microwave Room was in need of maintenance. Missing baseboard, peeling paint, torn wallpaper

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Good Location No frills...just the way I like it”
Reviews.Author: sikat2009
Reviews.Content: Generally I like no frills business type hotels b/c I generally don't stay in much.This hotel is generally wll run and the staff is unobstrusive.The front desk is generally helpful, but on this particular occasion, I had a hard time getting hoild of them mostly likely b/c staffing issues and the volume of travellers .Booked by expedia so I could not use my HHonors code. The location by itself is worth the stay. - harbor on one side, marina on the other.Just a not so busy street with joggers and wannabes running up and down the shoreline.It is situated on a sliver of land .The airport is 3 minutes away by car but you can' hear the planes at al The parking is outdoors, which is ok, this is San Diego after all .The slots are skinny though so don't bring a hummer or any gas guzzling vehicle b/c you will need 2 slots. The rooms are well kept, slightly dated but clean.This is a business hotel basically in my view .The beds are some of the most comfortable I've slept in...consistent with all the hilton chains I have been too.Bathroom is small - built for one occupant at a time. There is one restaurant and it serves basic but good (pricey) food.. NO wireless internet in the rooms, Internet rates about 14/day.This is odd for a business hotel This hotel is definitely one you should consider if you're into basic clean quiet well run business type small hotels.Get your entertainment elsewhere as downtown is only 10 mins away.Make sure you get a high floor Harbor view.. plus some floors have palm trees which obstruct the view. Can't say much about the Marina view

Reviews.Title: “Accommodation not worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: chayes46
Reviews.Content: Spectacular harbor view. DreamsÂ® Bed not so comfortable. No wifi in rooms. Parking and internet COST EXTRA. I guess at $300/night they figure another $40-50 for amenities is a drop in the bucket. All amenities came at a price! 25" premium-cable TV with HBO with POOR quality picture!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and a very good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: digitalsausage
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in Feb 2011 for business trip. The room was very spacious and well equipped. The bed was particularly good, I slept really well. Feather pillows and good quality sheets make a real difference. I was on the 7th floor and had a brilliant view of the ocean from my balcony. If I had been staying for leisure it would have been nice to take breakfast out there in the mornings. Service was excellent throughout. I had to courier some equipment to the hotel in advance and they arranged safe delivery. We also needed taxis every morning to get across town and the receptionist was always quick to get our transport sorted. When I checked out the shuttle bus took me straight to the airport at no charge and without any hanging around waiting. My only niggle is that wireless internet was quite pricey and for a hotel of this standard it should be free. The bar was also a little bit pricey but as my drinks went on business expenses I indulged anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Better choices for the price”
Reviews.Author: Jpetrone
Reviews.Content: I booked a Deluxe 2 queen bed room to be told that they are only given based on availability at time of check in so you get the standard room at the same price. The bathroom was incredibly small for a Hilton property. As the restaurant closed for the day at 10:00pm we were forced to order Domino's Pizza as the only option to get something to eat. As the phone by the bed didn't work we used the desk phone which disconnected a few times in our attempt to call. Upon receiving our check out bill we were charged 1.15 for each attempted call. The hotel desk did waive the charges. The best part was upon ensuring we had everything, my husband found an empty liter bottle of vodka under the bed. So housekeeping needs to do a better job.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff that will take care of problems”
Reviews.Author: ZebraJim
Reviews.Content: On a 4 night stay, My first room just above and near the foyer had a problem with the internet router. That was ok to be fixed the next day. But then had some noisy guests and busses below constantly making back up beeping noise. So, I moved to another room that night at midnight to what seemed quite at first, until i was surrounded by arriving noisy folks besides, above and below until 2AM. Moved again day 2 to quiet room. Front desk staff was very accommodating and apologetic, totally determined to make it right and with complementary add-ons. Veteran business traveller here and that was the best staff experience I've had in many years. Hotel rooms are nice with great views. Have stayed in many hotels in SD on business always downtown. While there may be better appointed hotels in San Diego, this is the best staff I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough Hotel But Not Business Friendly”
Reviews.Author: They-Made-Me-Go
Reviews.Content: Although it is an old building and the rooms are small, the hotel is okay. The view from my room was nice. The staff were also friendly. The fact that there is no Wifi in the rooms and the in-room internet access is expensive was enough for me to decide I won't stay here again on business. The fitness centre was marginal, with a few machines and some weights. There was no way to clean the fitness equipment. There is also no Executive Floor or any "add-ons" for Hilton Honors Gold and Platinum Members. Overall, I would have to say that this is a sub-par Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “No wifi”
Reviews.Author: nomisDevon
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel - quiet and peaceful with some good views if you're lucky. However, rooms are quite small and there is no refrigerator or room safe. Main problem for me is that there is no wifi in the hotel and wired internet access or use of business center is expensive, therefore not the best for the business traveller. Staff were very apologetic and helpful but I had to move out to find somewhere more business friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: JunkyardWisdom
Reviews.Content: Staying at a Hilton should be a nicer experience than this. The parking was expensive and the parking meter didn't read my room key ... the layout of the building is confusing .... the food was overpriced ... the room key worked the first time I used it but not the second ... the bathroom was sparsely outfitted with just one set of towels .... you get the idea. I'd be fine with all of that if I was staying at a hotel aiming to be less than what a Hilton stands for. Or if I was paying $200 a night. But at nearly $400 a night, this should have been a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “A good quality Hilton”
Reviews.Author: 007DAWG
Reviews.Content: It is an older but very well maintained property with recently renovated rooms. The staff is friendly, and the location is good for access to the airport and downtown San Diego. Parking at $17 seems pretty high for the location, but overall this is a quality Hilton hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel when visiting San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Shadow-Dude
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Harbor Island the weekend before Thanksgiving to visit friends living near San Diego. The front desk staff was very pleasant and ready to assist in anyway possible. A couple of the highlights: Pros: Shuttle service to downtown San Diego for shopping, restaurants and tourist stuff with scheduled times. Shuttle Service to the train station upon request. Free WiFi in the lobby area. Great food and service in the hotel restaurant. We only ate breakfast there twice in 3 days so I cannot vouch for the dinners, but the breakfast was excellent. The lounge overlooks the small boat harbor and is a very relaxing place for a cocktail. Great views of either San Diego Harbor or the Harbor Island small boat harbor and airport. There are 3 very good restaurants and a deli whthin walking distance of the hotel. Very pleasant staff at the hotel. Everyone we encountered appeared to truly enjoy working there and it showed - 3 cheers for Hilton! Cons: Parking costs $17 per day extra. But parking costs extra for almost every hotel we looked at in the San Diego downtown area before we selected the Hilton Harbor Island. They charge your room for the per day charge which includes in and out privleges when you check in. We did not have a car, but our friends did so we asked for the parking. The staff immediately and without question removed the charges when we told them which days we did not use the parking. Free WiFi in the rooms would be a big plus. The WiFi in the lobby was weak in some areas. We left a note for more creamers and sugars for the in room coffee service that went unoticed, but when I asked one of the housekeeping staff for some, they were very accomodating. When the lounge is open, they need to have it staffed full time. We had to wait long periods for service at times when the bartender would just seem to disappear.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awesome view, well appointed room, thoughtful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Skipjack455
Reviews.Content: To celebrate our 33rd wedding anniversary my wife and I chose to stay at this hotel and we're glad we did. We stayed for only a single night and did not use the pool or excercise facilities, so I cannot comment on those features. I booked the room through Priceline and got a good rate for the king bed and harbor view room. Upon checking in at the front desk I inquired if a room on the top floor was available (for the enhanced view). While the clerk was checking on the availability I casually mentioned that my wife and I were celebrating our wedding anniversary. The clerk informed me that a room was indeed available but it had a Jacuzzi whirlpool tub that normally goes for a higher rate. She said she would be happy to upgrade us to the new room at no charge - if we were interested. Needless to say we were very happy with that arrangement! After leaving our baggage in our room we left for dinner at a local harborside fish grotto. Upon returning to our room we discovered a bottle of champagne in an ice-filled bucket accompanied by two champagne flutes and a personally-composed card from Kie Horike and Fatima Sayre, the two employees manning the front desk, on behalf of the hotel staff congratulating us on our anniversary. What a kind and thoughtful gesture! Our room was attractively decorated in the modern style, had a new LG flat screen television and ample dresser space. The bathroom was commodious and well appointed as well with all the usual ammenities (hair dryer, soap, shampoo, etc.) An iron and ironing board were located in the wardrobe. The bed was large and comfortable and had 5 fluffy pillows. A writing desk with a broadband connection (not free) was located in one corner of the room. Ample stationary and writing implements were available as well. The view from the balcony afforded a 180 degree vista of downtown San Diego, the Coronado bridge, NAS North Island and Point Loma. The view was especially pretty the night we stayed because of the holiday lights on the buildings downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: MonikaV8
Reviews.Content: We had a king room that faced the harbor and it was wonderful! The weather was beautiful, we had our sliding glass door open all night. Our terrace had just enough room to sit and drink coffee and watch the fog burn off with the rising of the sun; and the lights come on at sunset. The bed was so comfortable. The green and brown fabrics were different, modern--but I liked them. The bathroom was spacious. Plenty of granite counter space! Easy access to the harbor sidewalk, where i was enticed to join the runners, but remained in the comfort of the room. There are fees for internet, parking and the bottled water, but I had a room with a view and loved it! The staff was friendly and helpful, thank you all from front desk to maintainence (thanks for the chocolate!)

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price, not even complimentary coffee.”
Reviews.Author: velcro46
Reviews.Content: Disappointed. Price, tax, parking made the overall price non-competitive with other local hotels. Unfortunately, I booked non-refundable. In room web access was unavailable. Front desk staff were hardly ever actually at the front desk. Elevators took several minutes when rooms were being cleaned because there is no service elevator or alternate means (stairs) for me to access my room. NO COFFEE in the lobby!? I was told by the manager that they had discontinued this service two years ago as a cost saving measure, and that the Sheraton down the street had a Starbucks. I can get free coffee at a Motel 6. It's a big deal, believe me. Overall this hotel was more interested in their bottom line than they were in repeat customers....and that's what they got. I'm starting to become very disillusioned with Hilton in general. My stays have been less than spectacular to say the least. Trying to be a loyal Hilton Honors member, but frankly, it doesn't seem worth the trouble, or value.

Reviews.Title: “Fine to stay at but not the best”
Reviews.Author: ZIZO_Elegant_Travel
Reviews.Content: this is one of the hotels that have very good location & view but the hotel is little bit old style. but it is fine to stay at. very good room service, & self parking service. the shuttle bus service is very good, the hotel is very close to airport & sea world. the rooms are very big & well equipped. the elevators & pathways are not newly furnished.

Reviews.Title: “Gordon Ramsey where are you...?”
Reviews.Author: HongKongMember
Reviews.Content: Arrived late so chose to eat dinner in the restaurant. Please don't make the same mistake as I did. Appalling. Breakfast not attempted after the dinner experience. Otherwise an OK Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: DFJJB
Reviews.Content: As usual, Hilton beds are awesome, so no complaints there. I just felt that paying over $200 per night was a little much. My son did enjoy the pool -although it's a little small. I didn't eat at the restaurant as there were better places to eat within driving distance. I will say that our few was nice -we got a Harbor view (but paid extra for it. Lastly, my wife forgot something in our room (a hat) when we checked out. I called the hotel and eventually they told me they had it. I went to pick it up and it had disappeared. I'm still waiting for someone to let me know if they ever found it again -they said they would mail it to me.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: socalbeachbum97
Reviews.Content: I'm giving this Hilton property a rating of 5. We hotel hop in San Diego frequently and have returned here for several reasons, but mostly because of its value. The property is in a good central location to explore downtown, Sea World or visiting La Jolla, Mission Beach, OB etc. Staff is excellent. The hotel has the basic amenities- pool, gym, jacuzzi. This is not a resort property by any means- it's a place you feel comfortable and look forward to putting your head down to rest. Rooms are functional, pleasant and clean. They have one of the best housekeeping services out there. The hotel stays busy but it never feels crowded. It is mostly suitable for a maturer crowd and families. We have always enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BedBuggin
Reviews.Content: Hotel was right next to the marina across from San Diego airport. It was reasonably quiet as it faces the water rather than the airport. The staff was very accommodating even after a mix up in the room request. This is great location if you want to be in and out of the airport fast at the same time it offered a quiet location as opposed to the downtown or Gaslamp District area. I really have no complaints and would definitely stay here again next time I am in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at this hotel goes above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: mommajoColumbus_Ohio
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I traveled to San Diego for the first time. At the front desk "Marco" helped us decide what to do in the area. We took the seal tour (land/water vehicle) It was WONDERFUL. When my daughter got ill and we were supposed to check out, they helped us extend our stay (we were using hilton points) The hotel was very serene and my daughter was able to sleep off her headache in peace while I sat on the balcony reading and watching sailboats go by...truly a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel -- Marvelous Location -- Helpful Service”
Reviews.Author: IowaGrandparents
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a Hilton with a grand lobby, you picked the wrong hotel. If you're looking for an awesome location with spectacular views of the fleet coming in and out of the harbor and a terrific location for a morning run or walk, you hit the bullseye. All told, for its location this is still a pretty average hotel. But the staff from check in to check out to breakfast to shuttle was prompt, helpful, and pleasantly congenial. Dinner is the restaurant was average for a hotel restaurant but in a really beautiful setting overlooking the marina and aquariums for the internal walls. A particular strength is the shuttle on demand. With only a two minute drive to the terminal and no waiting time for the shuttle to be available, that's worth an extra hour of sleep in the morning before a flight. A very nice property for a short business based visit. For vacation or family outing, the downtown properties such as the Embassy Suites still excel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport”
Reviews.Author: bebedani
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice. It was close to the airport which was very helpful. The shuttle ran well and we didn't have to wait long for it to arrive. The room was decent and the bed was comfortable. Although i was never asked if I wanted a king or double bed. The pool was nice and warm, but small, however since no one else was in it , it was a good size. Not the most relaxing pool, as people from the parking lot walk by to enter the hotel. One other reviewer mentioned banging pipes. I heard the same noise, however I only heard it once, and it stopped, maybe they have fixed the problem? The woman working in the gift shop was very nice. And the shop had everything you would need, and was open until 10pm, which alot of hotel stores close much earlier. One BIG complaint and why I wont rate it higher, the business center cost $$$, you had to pay to access the internet, and the only free wifi was in the lobby, who wants to sit in the lobby and do work? My other complaint is that they don't offer free breakfast, and when traveling for work, I always want to save money. I wanted to rate this higher but those are 2 major things a business traveler needs and I cant afford to pay for internet on the road.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms and public spaces have been...”
Reviews.Author: tvhtml
Reviews.Content: The rooms and public spaces have been recently renovated at this older Hilton property, but some details were missed. The bathroom ceiling of my 5th floor room was uneven and open in places and the tub drain area was peeling. Next time I am in San Diego, I will probably stay at the Hilton Bayside.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, gorgeous view but no view of downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: momoftwo09
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel for 4 nights with a harborview, which is what I got. The room was extremely clean and spacious with a balcony. The only thing is that this hotel is curved so depending on where your room is located, you don't get a view of the whole harbor. It was across from the navel air strip. It wasn't really quite either. The last morning I was there, a fishing boat pulled up at around 7 am and was talking to the people on the boat over his loud speaker. It was a good thing I was already awake! For the price, it was an exceptional hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “very nice airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: WaterEnthusiasts
Reviews.Content: On a combined business/family getaway, we spent one night here, and would return. It is much prettier and more relaxing than a person from the Northeast would expect a major airport hotel to be. There was a neighborhood with a lot of restaurants and a nice Vons supermarket, just a very short drive away. Front desk staff was very helpful with directions. Walking along the bay, sitting on the balcony, and the small pool were all pleasant. It is not a vacation resort; it's a business-oriented airport hotel, but very nicely done.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: imeasher
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel located close to the airport on harbor island. The hotel room we had was comfortable and had all the amenities we needed. The bed was comfortable and the work desk and high speed internet were excellent. The staff was very responsive to all of our needs and did an outstanding job with a smile the whole stay. The shuttle service to the Airport was extremely friendly. We had Dinner at the hotel and the food was delicious and the service was fast and friendly. Overall we had a great time and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: MacVol
Reviews.Content: By and large, I have had good stays at this property over the past year. The location is convenient to the airport, and the van service is efficient and friendly. As a Diamond, I have been able to get rooms with a great view. In addition, the restaurant/lounge is quite convenient, and the service is good. My most recent stay, in December, was somewhat disappointing. First of all, my pre-order did not arrive at all--even though the front desk apologized profusely. Secondly, I was given Continental Breakfast coupons, but was told to rush because the staff was breaking down the buffet bar--not a very customer-oriented approach. Unfortunately this particular Hilton provides "ho-hum" extras to Golds/Diamonds other than Harbor View rooms. In addition, they nickel and dime through an exorbitant $17 self parking charge and internet fees (like a lot of other Hiltons). Despite irritating occurrences on my last stay, I'll select this property again. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable; the location is convenient to where I need to be. The front desk service has been pretty good. It would be nice if this property could just step it up a notch or two in overall value.

Reviews.Title: “If you can pick a room...”
Reviews.Author: tpaulh
Reviews.Content: Request a room on the south side looking toward Coronado. West side is nice for sunsets (which can also be seen from many rooms on the south side), but can get hot in the afternoon sun. The east side overlooking the Marina and downtown is okay, but you get the constant noise from the A/C and restaurant fans below, ruining the pleasure of sitting on the balcony or leaving the balcony door open for fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the Hilton Harbor Island”
Reviews.Author: NoWorriesGuy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton during the International Comic Con July 23-26. I wasn't with the convention but needed to be is San Diego. The rates througout downtown were very high so I opted to stay on Harbor Island. The HIlton is nice and did a good job of meeting our needs for the weekend. I can't say that any part was exceptional, it was just your standard Hilton quality. The building has nice water views on each side so you can't go wrong with picking this hotel if you want to enjoy a relaxing view from your balcony. For a quick weekend or business trip the Hilton Harbor Island would be a good pick for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, but I expected more from this Hilton”
Reviews.Author: crazyhotelguy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel due to the fact that if offered an airport shuttle. I had booked an overnight connection through SAN and needed a nice hotel by the airport for one night. When I called the hotel at 12:05 AM, for the shuttle, I was told that the shuttle ended at midnight. After a little hesitation, I was told that I should take a cab and that the hotel would pay for the cab, but I felt like this was all my fault for not know this..... I did take a cab and since I felt that I had been a bit abrasive with the front desk agent, I chose not to accept the offer for the cab fare. It was only $6.... The check in was quick and convenient. The room seemed nice, but pretty basic. the room was pretty large and had the basics in furnishings. My big surprise came in the morning when i woke up to a sink full of sludge. I was less than impressed with this as I was in a bit of hurry to get ready, have breakfast, and get to the airport. I chose to take a shower and just brush my teeth using the tub faucet. At some point during my shower, the watery sludge in the sink decided to begin draining. The problem is that it decided to drain all over the floor, leaving dried sandy sludge in the sink. Being in a slight bit of a hurry. I did not have time to deal with maintenance and all. I informed the front desk and then proceeded to the restaurant for breakfast. The staff was friendly. I had a continental breakfast coupon due to status, but chose to upgrade this to the full buffet. The buffet was average at best in comparison to other full service Hilton Hotels, however, the food they had was very good. I was not offered a menu, so I assume there was no menu / a la carte option. Check out was quick with no compensation offered, and the shuttle promptly took me to the airport. The pros of this hotel are its convenience to the airport and the friendliness of the staff. Also the view from my room was great. The cons are that the shuttle does not run for the last arriving flights, the rooms are average (kind of plain, though I like the colors.), and you might have a surprise in your sink in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Harbor Island? Keep looking...”
Reviews.Author: sandog09
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights here recently. I paid the upgrade fee for a harbor view at time of reservation and was assured I would have a city view. I also requested a bottle of champagne and cheese tray to be delivered at check in. The room was located on the far right side of the building facing away from the city. Because of the curvature of the front face, the only view I had was of the North Island landing strip. The city downtown couldn't be seen at all. The wine and cheese was not delivered within an hour of check in so I called a second request. It never showed. I complained to the desk manager who basically told me to take a hike. The good news, however, is I went back a few days later and stayed at the Sheraton Harbor Island just down the street. It was awesome. The people were great, the room and view were excellent. Save yourself some grief and don't bother with Hilton Harbor Island.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View”
Reviews.Author: Alan17
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently located near the airport but it is slightly far from the hustle & bustle of the main city. However the hotel has regular free bus service to the main market area. The view of the sea across the road is very beautiful. The only thing lacking is that it does not have a steam or sauna facility, and there is not much to see around in the vicinity. Otherwise the staff is quite good & friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Yelch.”
Reviews.Author: Yelch
Reviews.Content: Never again. While waiting for my room on by the pool, a guest threw a used condom from her balcony to the pool deck near where I was sitting. Is the quality of the hotel a reflection of the guests it attracts? When I brought this to the attention of the front desk manager, she said "how gross". Nothing was done to assure me the mess would be cleaned up, dealt with, or anything. Very disgusting experience, not at all my kind of place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for night before flight home”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglandTraveler09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before flying out of San Diego. The hotel was clean, close the airport, and the rooms were nice. I would recommend for anyone who needs a place to stay close to the aiport. The room service was very over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton-Harbor Island- How Did I miss this one?”
Reviews.Author: JenaiMorehead
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really a surprise. I stayed in April 2009 for some rest and to ride my bicycle around Mission Bay. I stayed for less than $100. Parking was $17 per day(grumble-grumble). I got over it soon because the staff was nice and even stored my bike for me and took it out everytime I needed it. The staff honored my request for a marina view (work your own majic). It is less than 3 miles from the airport on a strip of land called Harbor Island. Harbor Island Blvd is the main and only street on the strip. On one side of the strip of land is a large marina with pretty boats and on the other side is the San Diego Bay. The hotel is built so that it has 3 sides. you are always going to have a water view mixed with land. The out side looks a little retro but the inside is modern and clean. The restaurant was a little expensve but very nice to sit and relax over a good meal or breakfast. My room/bathroom was clean and had nice/new decor, upgrades on tile etc. and furniture. Right in front of the hotel is a small pak on the bay. (nice). While the airport is very close I was not bothered by any sounds. I stayed 2 glorius days and only heard 2 planes. Each room has a balcony with a small table and 2 chairs. Next to the hotel are 2 restaurants and a small convinience store that many hotel guests frequent. The hotel has a reasonably priced gift shop (more jewelry than food) There are 2 large Sheratons that neighbor this Hilton. The hotel is less than 6 miles from all the nice downtown attractions (see my San Diego Review). The only thing that dissapointed me was that their advertisement said they had free internet.. They do-in the lobby. I had to pay an additonal $11 for internet access in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot to overnight”
Reviews.Author: eawnyc
Reviews.Content: I needed a clean and easy to reach location from the San Diego airport for a one night overnight. The Hilton San Diego Airport/Harbor Island had the best rate for a 'brand' hotel. Within minutes of my call to the hotel, the airport shuttle arrived at the airport to pick me up. Couldn't have been easier. Checkin was swift and I was off to my room. The room met my needs. If I were staying longer, I would want a newer hotel (this one feels like it needs to be updated ... had that sea air smell and feel). And, you can hear the plumbing from other rooms which can be disturbing if you are not a heavy sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Not as described”
Reviews.Author: SeasideForus
Reviews.Content: It is conveniently located by the airport and right on the bay. At check-in they try to downgrade our room - WATCH OUT! - and told us we do not have a room with balcony booked, even at we showed the confirmation; they told us we do not have booked this room. The room we got was ok, but a little bit old and needed some work, foremost in the bath room. The hotel was in construction and we did not have this information until check-in. Construction comes with noise, we got this at 10:00PM at the time we checked in. The restaurant was closed the next day and the day after, we could not get our breakfast in bed as advertised. The internet connection was extremely pricey, EXTREMLY. So if you need a high speed internet connection, look better for another hotel. At check-out day the room service knocked at 7:50AM on our room door and tries to kick us out of the hotel. That was not ok, not ok at all. I do not recommend this hotel, they need a lot of work to upgrade and fix the attitude problems of the employee. So stay away until they change, change a lot. The taxi charge to downtown ran about $15 - downtown is located 3 - 4 miles from the hotel. There's a nice walking path in front of the hotel that runs the lengh of Harbor Island. There's a small store and restaurant located north of the property too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pr123
Reviews.Content: Our family arrived in San Diego late and stayed overnight at the Hilton before driving to our resort the next morning. We did this once before, and found it much more relaxing than renting a car and driving 1 hour after a full day travelling. Arriving at the airport we called the hotel and they had a shuttle to pick us up within 5 minutes. The shuttle driver was friendly and very helpful. When we arrived at the hotel the front desk remembered our name; a nice touch. They gave us recently refurnished rooms which were very nice. Breakfast in the morning was good; again great service. I wanted to pick up my rental car before checking out; and when I asked how best to get there the concierge offered to drive me in the shuttle bus. Overall, everything is what I would expect from an airport Hilton; but the exceptional service put it over the top! I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Alina77419
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our stay here. The views are beautiful from every floor (we were on the second one and it was still nice). There was no noise from the airport (even though it was very close by). The staff was very attentive and we received great customer service. A few examples: forgot toothbrushes, but they had some; the hairdryer went out, but they brought a replacement within 5 min; the shuttle to the airport was prompt and the drivers very pleasant. And.. the best part... Lavazza coffee provided in the room... :) We had very nice breakfast in the downstairs hotel two days in a row; tip: make sure you ask for a menu - you don't have to get the buffet for $18.95. There are other things on the menu which are better and cheaper - the crab benedicts were $14.95 and they were yummy! You may want to rent a car - the hotel is not close to public transportation. We didn't... but a cab to the Gaslamp Quarter was only $15. From there we used public transit to the Maritime Museum and Old Town. Keep in mind hotel parking is $17/day on top of the rental car costs.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for the Airport”
Reviews.Author: Geraint Jones
Reviews.Content: A nice comfortable hotel near the airport with good views across the harbour. Just had the nachos in the bar so can't comment on the restauraunt but the breakfast was fine. We only had a few hours in San Diego as we were visiting family all day but we really wished we could have stayed here longer. You get a courtesy bus to the airport and we had a lovely driver who's wife came from Scotland! They tried to charge for overnight parking so we took the car back to the hire depot and walked back to the hotel along the sea front. Had a peaceful hour sat outside the bar overlooking the marina.

Reviews.Title: “So unlike an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: ooonor
Reviews.Content: This hotel keeps getting better and better. In no particular order: 1) The breakfast, free for gold and diamond VIPs, has expanded to include hot and cold cereal, cold cuts and salmon, pastries, surprisingly good scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles, and more. Really something for everyone. 2) The staff is flexible and understanding. This week I left two days early and the $50 early-checkout fee was waived without me even asking. 3) the location does NOT feel like an airport. Most rooms face San Diego harbor, the rest the pretty marina, where one can watch sailboats race almost every evening. Walking distance takes you to one of San Diego's best restaurants, C-level Lounge and Island Prime. I honestly didn't hear airport noise.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chizzi
Reviews.Content: Well, it conveniently located by the airport and located right on the bay. Very nice scenery and little traffic. It's in a bit of a remote area since the property is located on Harbor Island. The food was pricey and you have to pay to get on the Internet in the business office. The room was good but despite the scenery around, I had a commanding view of air duct work. I usually take the stairs and had to walk through the kitchen/employees break area to get from the nearest stairs to the lobby. The taxi charge to downtown ran about $15 - downtown is located 3 - 4 miles from the hotel. There's a nice walking path in front of the hotel that runs the lengh of Harbor Island. There's a small store and restaurant located north of the property too.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DancingNancys
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Hilton and chose this hotel for its proximity to the airport. Based on other reviews I was concerned about what we would experience here! We had a very nice, clean,spacious room overlooking the harbor. All encounters with the staff were positive.The public areas of this hotel were very nice too. The shuttle service took us to Oldtown for dinner and picked us up. We had a very early flight the following day and the shuttle took us to the airport at 4:45am. We were very pleased with the hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just a pretty building. . .”
Reviews.Author: tyruscooper
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Harbor Island San Diego, CA from March 27 â€“ Apr 01 this year. I have never been so unsatisfied with the level of customer service from any hotel. We never received clean towels or linens even though we constantly asked the cleaning crew for them. Our bathtub was clogged the whole time we were there [which we called 3 times on but it never got repaired]. We were double charged for food. On top of all we were never once asked how our stay was. It just felt as if they really didnâ€™t care for customer satisfaction. Booking online showed a Marina View room, however did not mention anything about the hotel restaurant blocking almost the entire room. When asked if we could get a room with a better view, even if on the same floor we were told by the front desk that nothing was available without even looking for availability as if they were just brushing us off. The only pleasing experience with the staff was with the Staff in the restaurant â€“ top notch! Having a beautiful hotel on the waterfront should NOT take away from the level of customer service, if anything it should only COMPLIMENT it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Time at the HIlton”
Reviews.Author: dynarider
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Airport/Harbor Hilton for three days. Booked it on Priceline for $75.00 per night. Parking was $17.00 per night. Room was decent though quite small, queen sized bed, marina/harbor view, nice balcony. The front desk told us about a shuttle to the Gaslamp District four times a day, but what they didn't tell us is that if they don't take the shuttle there, they may not send a pick up shuttle there, and you will need to call. We opted to walk/stroll (this is about a 4 mile walk) down there and then waited for the shuttled at 8:20PM only to end up taking a taxi back ($15.00). From then on we had a card and called they always picked us up and shuttled us to where ever we wanted to go. Paul did a great job for us! My advice is do not eat at the restaurantt there. We did just because we were tired but we should have gone back into town. Overall, staff was all great, stay was good. Hotel is out on the marina but there is a nice walking path to the harbor, gas lamp, little Italy. The shuttle is a huge plus! Tip your driver well.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel - parking rip off”
Reviews.Author: dbernstein
Reviews.Content: I used hotwire and got this as a 3 star hotel. I was actually pleased I got a name brand (Hilton), but that faded when I checked in. It's not a bad hotel, it's just not good either. Pool is tiny and the $17 self-parking is ridiculous. When the dorrman asked if I needed help with my luggage I said no. He then immediately told me to move my car... his way of getting to me for not tipping I guess. We just stayed one night, but unless you have a deal or want Hilton points I would say to stay elsewhere. On the positive side, the view was nice. We stayed in the Mission Bay area for the rest of our trip, and every hotel there looks out onto a harbour so it's not really a big deal in San Diego to have a water view. Here is a tip. The Marina next door has a small convenience store/deli that is open until 7:00. It also has outdoor tables overlooking the Marina. We went there and had a few beers and I got my daughter an ice cream... we probably saved $20 over the Hilton Bar and had a nice view as well.

Reviews.Title: “Business meeting with no internet!”
