Reviews.Author: kaybabee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok, nothing special. We had a large business meeting there but very few of us could ever get internet access! Most of us had to ask them to take it off of our bills at the end. I averaged about 5 hours total over 3 days. I was on the phone for almost an hour with the tech help and they never figured out what was going on. The view from the room was the marina so that was nice but not much else to tell. Dated but the staff was good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel right on the water”
Reviews.Author: boutiquee
Reviews.Content: We got married at this hotel and the staff was very accommodating and the hotel has a very beautiful location. It is located very close to the Airport and is very centrally located on the Harbor. Many of our guest stayed at the hotel and really enjoyed it as well. The food in the restaurant is surprisingly fantastic and the restaurant was very nice. We stayed in a suites (not sure if it was the honeymoon suite) and it was very nice with even a heated toilet seat! This hotel is literally right on the water, and all the rooms have a great view. Our guest stayed in standard rooms and they were very nice as well! Every balcony has a water view! For those of you who are not familiar the harbor is very narrow so you pretty much have water on both sides of you! It is very close to Sea World, and not far from the freeway. Some of our guest left the hotel and went straight to the airport so this was very convenient. Great hotel! Friendly Staff. Beautiful surroundings!

Reviews.Title: “Good, reliable airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phil2016
Reviews.Content: The Hilton on Harbor Island is certainly nothing to write home about, but did offer the basic expectations for a Hilton property. Room was very clean, though the furniture somewhat dated. Very comfortable bed; small television. Arrived at 10:30 am and requested early check-in. As HH Gold, she apologized that she didn't have any rooms with a "good view," but since it was just one night and I would be gone all day, I took what she had (an 8th floor room, across from the elevator, overlooking the marina and airport). Despite being right at the elevator, noise was never a problem. The only real complaint I have about the hotel was the loud noises made by the water pipes in the hotel. Any toilet flushing or shower running was very loud. That could have had something to do with location of my room...not sure. Would've self-parked, but felt $17/day for that location was a bit extreme, and opted to return the car to Hertz before returning to the hotel that night. They do have 4-5 check-in parking spaces with a 15-minute limit (I left my car there for 30 mins with no problem). Wireless high-speed at $11/day was reliable. This wouldn't be a top choice hotel for a longer stay in San Diego, but for catching an early AM flight, definitely a safe bet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok hotel, staff tries hard”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Drew2
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Harbor Island has a great location and I can't imagine that any room has a bad view. It's a concave-triangular building, similar to the Las Vegas Hilton, but much smaller. One side directly faces the bay and Coronado. The other faces the harbor and Point Loma. The other side faces the harbor and airport. The location is not convenient to anything except the airport, but it's not far from downtown or the beaches. At check-in we were given a bag full of what they called "brain food" for being HHonors Diamond. The bag contained lots of snack foods, at least $10 worth. We were also given breakfast buffet coupons for the two of us. Parking is expensive at $17/day. We booked a "select room at check-in" at the AAA rate of $143/night and were given a corner room with a queen bed on the 8th floor . There are 9 floors. Our room was on the smaller side but not terribly small. Other rooms down the hall had couches in them. Ours didn't because there was no space. The toiletries were the usual Crabtree and Evelyn, La Source. Our room faced the harbor and Pt. Loma and had some noise from the airport but not bad. The bathroom is tiny. The breakfast was good, not great. I think the full price of it was $17+. The selection was ok but not extensive. The coffee was good. The restaurant has a nice harbor view. The staff were really nice. Overall, the hotel was ok with nothing special except the amazing views. I wouldn't pay more than $150/night to stay there, keeping in mind the price to park too.

Reviews.Title: “Major Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: FlaTravelMan
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler who spends many nights in hotels, I was severely disappointed with this hotel. It was a two star hotel charging 4 and 5 star prices. Positives: Location is convenient and very nice area. Negatives: 1. The staff is rude and unaccomodating. Do not depend on the shuttle service to serve your needs while in San Diego. I called the hotel when I arrived at the airport. I had to call 3 times and wait an hour before they picked me up. They also drop guests off in nearby downtown and tell you to call when you are ready to be picked up. Good luck getting picked up within an hour and a half. Next time I will rent a car or just take a taxi. By the way, the Hilton charges $17per night to self park. 2. The phone in the guest room did not function. 3. There was no hot water the first day. 4. The rooms were similar to what you may find at a roadside motel. I will look elsewhere next time I visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gorgeous location”
Reviews.Author: AZ_mom
Reviews.Content: Subject: San Diego Location: San Diego, California, United States, North America Title: Awsome view of harbor ID#: 8697372 We stayed here over the Labor Day weekend and fell in love with the view from our balcony. I called the hotel a few days before our visit and confirmed my request for a harbor view room. Even if we were in the other wings facing the marina or city, we still would have liked this hotel. Right across the street is a small park and you can also walk or jog right along the water. My husband did this instead of working out in the hotel's exercise room. I loved walking in the evening with the lights of downtown as a backdrop. Since our room wasn't ready yet when we arrived, we sat by the water's edge and enjoyed the view of downtown San Diego, the activity on the harbor, and the helicopters taking off from the navy base directly across from us. Seeing the Coronado Bridge in the distance was also beautiful. One morning we opened the drapes and there was a Carnival cruise ship going by. Location of hotel was also great and close to Balboa Park and downtown with all its restaurants and activities. The hotel, however, seems to be slow on the housekeeping side. Our room wasn't ready until the check-in time of 4 pm and on each day of our stay, the room wasn't cleaned until late afternoon. The room was nice although I did notice a piece of peeling drywall over the bathtup. We had no trouble with bed bugs. Had a slow drain in the bathtub and it was fixed right away. The staff was really friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was nice too and the chef always had a special and different egg dish each morning. There was fresh fruit, pastries, and hot and cold cereal if you ended up tired of eating the eggs, belgium waffles or pancakes. I have been to almost all the Hilton properties in San Diego and wished I had tried this hotel a lot sooner. I am looking forward to returning to this hotel and its gorgeous view. I don't think there's any other Hilton property that has water front rooms like this. Hilton La Jolla may be more luxurious and upscale but they don't have a view like this hotel does.

Reviews.Title: “Should've listened to the reviews.”
Reviews.Author: winter_turtle
Reviews.Content: Should've listened to the other reviewers. The hotel served its purpose. We paid a discounted rate and got a discounted room. The front desk refused to change the room because of that, so we looked at the roof of the valet area. The bathroom was tiny and in need of some repairs. The pool area was very small and next to a parking lot. The shurbs didn't help. Food is terrible in the bar area with not enough channels to watch sports (basic ESPN). Would NEVER go back. Our first choice was the Sheraton on Harbor Island, but that was sold out.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised, above average for 3 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Melanie28
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed at this place for 1 night. Check in was easy and friendly. Parking was $17 a day...no security gate to pass through upon entering the parking lot (it's left open) but to leave the parking lot you need your room key. The room was well appointed, newer than the Holiday Inn we just moved from in Mission Valley. Compared to the Holiday Inn, the Hilton was brighter, cleaner, and felt like a 3.2-3.5 star hotel. We didn't hear the airplanes very much unless the balcony door was open, but even then it wasn't that loud. Hotel has a nice pool and gym. Maid service was super friendly and provided any additional things we needed with a smile. Negatives: Popcorn ceilings, Ceiling in the shower looked like it had water damage, can hear very loudly the water pipes when someone is showering. We had two beds in the room, looked like two full size beds rather than two queens. The beds aren't that comfortable but neither were the Holiday Inn beds. The traffic to get out of the hotel was pretty bad because of airport congestion. Although Little Italy is very close, it takes some time to get past the airport. We would probably stay here again if the rate was good. Lots of people fishing along the harbor, good sidewalk to take long walks. No restaurants in walking distance. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. I wish I hadn't read the previous tripadvisor review though because I was scared of bed bugs and didn't sleep well. None of us have welts on our body, thank goodness.

Reviews.Title: “Be wary”
Reviews.Author: jaysue
Reviews.Content: Twice now we have stayed at this hotel. Both times given a inferior room because it was discounted. Last year in June 2006 I explained it was our Anniversary celebration and they were going to put us over the lobby, and I asked for a better room and it was explained it was a discounted room rate. But after a bit of pleading he conceded and we were given a nice room. The stay was pleasant and the room very comfortable. Then again this last week we stayed there and was given a room across from the elevator and when asked for another quieter room we were given a room that was worse than the first. Across from the vending machines and no view, only a pitch rooftop directly in front of our window, if it had been explained that the hotel was booked etc. and was told to us that the room across from elevator was the best they could do we would of understood, but to knowingly put us in a worse room was VERY RUDE!!. So my warning to you is that if you use a discounted website, you are pretty much at there mercy..

Reviews.Title: “smells like cigaretts”
Reviews.Author: beacho
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for an extended weekend and conference. The hotel is conveniently located next to the airport and close to downtown, Old Town, and beaches. The hotel room didn't have King size bed available to us even though i offered to pay more for one. We were assigned to a room on the 4th floor. As soon as we got off the elevators, the smell of cigarette smoke was strong. Although our room didn't smell strongly of cigarettes, it did have the slightest hint. We immediately called down to the front desk. They reassured us that we werenâ€™t in a smoking room or smoking floor. They told us that smoking was not allowed in the hotel and that some other guest was smoking and they would investigate. Luckily we didn't spend much time in our room. San Diego is a lovely City. We enjoy exploring it. If you must stay here, please avoid the 4th floor. I recommend the Sheraton next door!.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bravofamily
Reviews.Content: The architecture of the hotel is older but they've renovated everything with new fixtures, paint, furniture, carpet, molding. The beds and pillows and linens were high quality. Everything was very clean. Unless you're looking very closely, it's by no means an outdated place. Staff was friendly, room service was great. Food from the restaurant downstairs is typically a tad pricey for what you get (about $10 and up) but it tasted great. The pool was a nice place to hang out. If you're traveling with family that likes to hang out at the pool, I'd suggest a room with Pool view. It makes for a nice time when those who don't want to be in the pool can visit with the people below from their balcony. I booked this place off hotwire for $94 a night. What a STEAL! I'm not sure i'd pay over $175 a night though.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it a lot!”
Reviews.Author: Watthree
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the San Diego Airport Hilton and had a great stay. The location is wonderful. Our room had a spectacular harbor view and it was nice to sit out on the (small) balcony. I was able to take a great run along the water. Even though it is close to the airport, I didn't hear any plane noise. All of the staff members were friendly and efficient. Check in was beyond easy. Coffee in the morning was great. Everything was clean and the pillows were amazing. I thought this was a great value. They even had a free shuttle to take visitors downtown, which was only 10 minutes away. Didn't have a chance to eat at the restaurant so can't rate that. Parking is $17/day, but I don't understand why people get so freaked out about that. Many hotels which are located in cities don't have free parking and $17 is much cheaper than the $30-40 I have paid at hotels on the east coast. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Served Its Purpose”
Reviews.Author: AustinTexan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, and our three children, stayed the night of Sunday, July 8, 2007 at the Hilton San Diego Airport/Harbor Island. I booked the hotel so as to faciltate catching an early flight the next morning. I booked the room on the Hilton website for $208/night. After reading a prior post, I am even more determined to use PriceLine. Nonetheless, I can't complain. We got a room with two doubles. I asked for a rollaway for the fifth sleeper but was advised that California law prevented that if the room had two beds. I don't know if that is true or not. Either way, one of the kids slept on a cozy combination of extra blankets and easy chair cushions. We did not use the restaurant. The hotel has a convenient little shop staffed by a very nice woman with snacks, drinks, nick-nacks and beach stuff. The hotel was convenient to everything one might want to see in San Diego. My only complaint is that the hotel believed it necessary to charge me $17 to park when the lot was so empty both the entry and exit gates were in the up position. This hotel served its purpose in that it was very convenient to turning in the rental car and catching the flight home. The room was nice and we had a small open air balcony to take in a view of the sailboats and part of the bay. All in all, we left satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Close and Convenient to Airport but Pricey”
Reviews.Author: ChristyP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton San Diego Airport/Harbor Island for one night because we had an early flight the next morning and were traveling with a three year old. We paid $219 per night through AAA....considerably higher than other people have reported. I am not sure why rates were so high ... maybe because it was a Tuesday night stay. I checked all over and it was the best I could find for that day. The shuttle service was WONDERFUL....we dropped off our rental car at the airport and they picked us up and brought us to the hotel. It was just as wonderful on the trip to the airport the next morning and saved us lots of time. The restaurant was good but fairly expensive. My husband and I had dinner and a glass of wine for $75. Suprisingly, the children's meal prices were very inexpensive (under $4.00). My daughter enjoyed the big saltwater fish tank sitting next to our booth. We had a non-smoking room with two double beds overlooking the water. The view was very nice and the beds were comfortable. The decor in the room was a bit dated and the bathtub needed to be re-grouted. It was very clean, but smelled like someone had been smoking in there previously. In general, it was a nice hotel, and I would have been happy if I had paid less than $175 per night to stay there. There was a nice business center but it cost .49 per minute to use the internet, so I passed. I was dissapointed that it was not complimentary. There was a coffee maker in the room but they were pretty stingy with the sweetener and creamer. The hotel worked out great for us because of the shuttle and the proximity to the airport, so we were happy with that aspect of our stay. We did not feel like it was a great value for a family, though.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: bj9030
Reviews.Content: Requested Non-smoking room. Room they gave us smelled like a carton of cigarettes was just smoked. When we complained about it, the front desk offered us a can of Lysol Spray. We threatened to leave, and they moved us to another room. This room was a utility closet, with a bed. It was sandwiched between the elevators and the hotels massive Air conditioning units. There was no place to sit, and you could barely walk around the bed. The view from our balcony was the rear of the air conditioning units, the facade wall to block the view of the air conditioning units from the parking lots, and a rooftop covered in cigarette butts and trash. All night long, we put up with the sound of the elevators and the constant rumbling of the A/C units, which sounded like a Semi Truck idling through the room. We complained, and Hilton's apology to us, was to refund the $26.00 parking fee they charged us. Avoid this hotel !!!!! They do not care about their guests. This was probably one of the worst experiences I have had at a hotel in all of my 50 years.

Reviews.Title: “Great View!”
Reviews.Author: Vis2020
Reviews.Content: Got a Sat night thru PL for $90. The staff was courteous. Got a 5th floor room that was clean and well appointed. The bathroom was small, but clean. Overall the room was your standard room. However, the view...the view overlooking the harbor was excellent. One negative was the $17 parking if you have a car. Would definitly stay here again if for under $100 a night

Reviews.Title: “not a typical Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Mugsydogg
Reviews.Content: This isnt a typical Hilton. The rooms are very old and not too comfortable. The hotel itself is in need of some updating. I was on the top floor and had a queen bed room. My bathroom was very small, and the shower/tub was one of the smallest I've been in. I hit my head on the towel rack inside the shower, twice. The a/c was also pretty loud and I could hear the "water pump" room across the hall whining all night. The location is near the airport, on harbor island, but if your set on the local, try the Sheraton down the road which is a lot nicer. For a Hilton, this isnt a very good example.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special...pretty standard”
Reviews.Author: Franchise35
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Harbor Island Hilton for one night on business. It's rather small for a Hilton but the rooms were quite big (was more like a suite with a separate living room/bar area and then the bed room (had 2 bathrooms as well). The location was great...literally a 5 minute drive from the airport so it was the ideal location for our conference. However it is RIGHT on the water so good to take a quick stroll. The hotel is only a 5 minute drive from downtown San Diego, so easily accessible. The restaurant was pretty average as far as hotel restaurants go (only ate brakfast there) and the bar/lounge was a little on the small side. Overall grade - standard Hilton hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money!”
Reviews.Author: molliemoleo
Reviews.Content: I surprised my husband with a quick weekend trip to San Diego for his birthday this year. I used Priceline to get a room and was initially HORRIFIED that I had been given an "airport" hotel when I was hoping for downtown. It ended up being perfect. We didn't get a king room, but the doubles were fine size and each room had it's own little balcony. It was clean and the staff (especially Marlon) were great. Parking was pretty reasonable for the city and the location was great! We did have a car that we used to go all around the city during the day and we took advantage of the hotel shuttle at night. They dropped us off at the Gaslamp District and it was about a $12 cab ride back. All in all, we had a great time and the hotel just amplified it!

Reviews.Title: “Better Options in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoFamily
Reviews.Content: Not worth $169 per night. Needs updating. Odd decor. On the plus side, the staff was very courteous. professional and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Old and bad services”
Reviews.Author: ILoveGoodHotel
Reviews.Content: # Bad: 1.My bag that was supposed to be brought up to the room when the room was ready never was brought up. 2. Floor in front of the shower got totaly wet when I took the shower. 3. The room was really old, may be clean but didn't feel like any of the other Hiltons I have stayed before. 4. he shortcut button to "front desk", "room service" etc did not work. 5. Room Service closed at 10:00 pm or 10:30 pm. # Good: Regretfully I can't think of any. If you have to stay close to the airport I would recommend the Sheraton, the price is similar and the hotel is so much nicer with so much to offer. If you stay at Sheraton I would recommend the West Tower which is cleaner with nicer room.

Reviews.Title: “Bring earplugs”
Reviews.Author: shakakan
Reviews.Content: Positives: Rooms were very clean and the beds were very comfortable. View would be great if you get a room on the front. Negatives: Toilet almost overflowed with nothing but toilet paper inside, unless you are on the top floor the noise is unbelievable, you can hear everything from rooms above and beside. When you book your room make sure there isn't anyone in the rooms around you or those comfortable beds won't matter.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Kimba57
Reviews.Content: We ended our 4-day San Diego trip with a night at the Hilton Harbor Island. I'm a Hilton Honors member, so I reserved the 2 rooms through them. The hotel seemed to be more of a boutique hotel - smaller with more personalized service. Our rooms and bedding were fantastic, comfortable and very clean. We had a bay view overlooking Coronado North Island and Downtown San Diego. We loved being able to sit on the balcony and enjoy the breeze and watch the boats and navy ships. Parking is easy with the lot being right outside the side entrance. Because the hotel is away from heavy traffic, it was easy to cross the street in the morning and enjoy a nice stroll along the bay. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The pool area is clean, but unimpressive. If you're looking for a place to do a lot of swimming with small children, you might want to look elsewhere. I would definitely stay here again. Even though it's near the airport, I didn't notice any noise and I found being able to sit on the balcony overlooking the bay to be extremely relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: Malynyk
Reviews.Content: Hello, My husband, daughter (6) and I along with my sister and her daughter (7) just returned from a vacation in San Diego. We stayed at the Hilton San Diego/Harbour Island and loved every minute of it. The hotel is centrally located which made it quite easy to get to all the destinations. After reviewing various tripadvisors for many hotels we settled on the Hilton. The hotel is very clean. The rooms all have balconies and each balcony offers the most gorgeous view of the harbour. The beds - while, what I can say, except they were more comfortable than home. The hotel staff were very accommodating and upon request we were moved to a king size bed with a pull out couch (2 adults and a child in a double bed just didn't work). I really only have two complaints - they should have queen size beds. (However, again the hotel did everything to accommodate us in a fast manner.) Second, there is a daily $15.00 parking charge (why not just include this in the hotel rate). We hadn't planned on having any meals in the restaurant although by day 3 or so we decided to give it a try. The meals were fabulous as we settled on the buffet breakfast. Excellent quality for the price and we should have had the breakfast right from day 1. Side notes: San Diego is a family oriented place to visit and this is why we chose it as our vacation spot. There is the Zoo which I highly recommend. The Animal Kingdom Park (good if you like lots of walking in the heat) (You don't really need both though). Sea World we never had a chance to visit. We did do a side day trip on our own to Tiajuana (that was different). Trolley - highly recommend this tour. You can get on and off at each destination. My husband thoroughly enjoyed the ship and submarine museums (this took my husband almost a day to do as there were so many to visit and so many interesting things to see) - the kids lasted about an hour and then we went to find shopping malls). Old Town - interesting. Made a fast stop to La Jolla - wow...wish we had more time to spend there. Coronado Island - Amazing Place (note, no beach chairs or surf boards for rent nor are their concession stands, the beach is just that - there were change rooms though). Last but not least, rent a car and drive the Pacific Coast Highway - awesome! Pat Manitoba, Canada August 9, 2006

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went there as a group, reserving around 20 rooms . . . Staff was OK but management and hotel were terrible Too much to post here and even not appropriate Bottom-line this is a Hilton hotel by name only. Or at least consider it a bigger motel or INN!!! Will never be back again even for a single room, better choice is the neighboring Sheraton. Please read the other reviews and judge yourself - be smart and find which review is from a real hotel goer and which is from a first time being in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: ShareTravelInfo
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week while on a business trip based on positive reviews...what a mistake! Paid $309 per night for "upper" floor with bay view. Upon check-in was given 2nd floor room with obstructed view after reserving weeks in advance. Next day moved to high floor room but had to vacate original room all day. Average room, outdated, no mini-bar. Room temperature bottled water costs $3.75. Overall just OK, certainly not worth the money. Would have moved to another hotel if there was any vacancy. Next time will go to the Sheraton up the street.

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton San Diego Airport/Harbor Island
HotelInfo.Address: 1960 Harbor Island Drive, San Diego, CA 92101
